@description.name: @description
@description.body: Root widget for the mobile application.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: root {Element?null} Optional. The root DOM element of the widget. Default is the body of the document.
@param.description: Optional. The root DOM element of the widget. Default is the body of the document.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: layout {qx.ui.mobile.layout.Abstract ? qx.ui.mobile.layout.VBox} The layout of the root widget.
@param.description: The layout of the root widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the native scrollbar should be shown or not.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The owning object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: {String} The ID of the object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event is fired when the app scale factor of the application has (or might have) changed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the application's total scale factor. It takes into account both the application's font scale (determined by {@link #getFontScale}) and the device pixel ratio. The latter could be modified at runtime by the browsers font scaling/zooming feature.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Number|null} the app scale factor. If a valid app scale could be determined, it is rounded to a two decimal number. If it could not be determined, null is returned.
@return.description: the app scale factor. If a valid app scale could be determined, it is rounded to a two decimal number. If it could not be determined, null is returned.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the application's font scale factor.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Number|null} the font scale factor. If a valid font scale could be determined, it is rounded to a three decimal number. For displaying the scale factor, you might want to round to two decimals (.toFixed(2)). If it could not be determined, null is returned.
@return.description: the font scale factor. If a valid font scale could be determined, it is rounded to a three decimal number. For displaying the scale factor, you might want to round to two decimals (.toFixed(2)). If it could not be determined, null is returned.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the application's font scale factor, i.e. relative to a default 100% font size.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the rendered width.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} the width of the container element.
@return.description: the width of the container element.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the rendered height.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} the height of the container element.
@return.description: the height of the container element.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event handler. Called when the orientation of the device is changed.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: evt {qx.event.type.Orientation} The handled orientation change event

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxOwner. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.
